snippet: Strikeouts are rising again in Major League Baseball, and front-office officials and managers seem resigned to the fact that swinging for the fences often results in more whiffs.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column observes that strikeouts are rising again in Major League Baseball, and front-office officials and managers seem resigned to the fact that swinging for the fences often results in more whiffs per game; notes that major league teams struck out 7.46 times per game in 2012, the hightest for any year in history.
lead_paragraph: Strikeouts are rising again in Major League Baseball, and front-office officials and managers seem resigned to the fact that swinging for the fences often results in more whiffs.

headline.seo: Climbing Number of Strikeouts Reflects a Quest for Power
headline.main: Climbing Number of Strikeouts Reflects a Quest for Power
headline.print_headline: Climbing Number of Strikeouts Reflects a Quest for Power
